alert.note: Alert for Northwestern San Juan Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 21 at 4:44AM MDT until March 23 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MDT THIS MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO MIDNIGHT MDT WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 18 inches with locally higher amounts possible. Winds gusting 65 to 75 mph mainly above 9500 feet. * WHERE...Northwest San Juan Mountains. * WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until 8 AM MDT Tuesday. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from noon Tuesday to midnight MDT Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. A detailed map of the snowfall can be found at: www.weather.gov/gjt/winter.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
